source: 211 North Carolina (nc211.org), North Carolina Department of Military & Veterans Affairs (milvets.nc.gov), Legal Aid of North Carolina, NCServes, NC4Vets

resources.name: NC 211 Information & Referral Service
resources.description: Free and confidential information and referral service for health and human services resources. Available 24/7/365 with multilingual support.

resources.name: NCServes - Coordinated Care Network for Veterans
resources.description: First and only statewide coordinated care network in North Carolina created specifically for Veterans, service members, and their families. Connects to over 2,000 community providers. HIPAA-compliant, free services, response within one business day.

resources.name: NC4Vets - Support Network for Military Veterans
resources.description: Comprehensive resource for veterans offering guidance, support, and direct assistance in accessing benefits, healthcare, and services. Operated in partnership with NC Department of Military & Veterans Affairs.

resources.name: North Carolina Department of Military & Veterans Affairs (DMVA)
resources.description: State agency providing comprehensive support to military personnel and veterans. Operates 12 State Veterans Service Centers plus county partnerships. Staff includes qualified benefits specialists.

resources.name: National Call Center for Homeless Veterans
resources.description: Free national service helping veterans experiencing homelessness locate and maintain housing. Offers phone and online chat support. No VA enrollment required.

resources.name: Veterans Restoration Quarters & Transitional Housing (ABCCM)
resources.description: 24-month transitional housing program for veterans. Converted motel facility providing temporary and transitional housing services.

resources.name: Steadfast House (ABCCM)
resources.description: Women's transitional housing program with accommodations for young children. Provides supportive housing for female veterans and their families.

resources.name: First at Blue Ridge (Vets First)
resources.description: Substance use disorder recovery services specifically for veterans. Provides treatment and recovery support.

resources.name: Family Forum (Independence Place)
resources.description: Transitional housing and support services for veterans in the Charlotte metropolitan area.

resources.name: Faith Farm (Lutheran Family Services)
resources.description: Women's transitional housing program for female veterans near Charlotte area.

resources.name: Healing Place of Wake County
resources.description: Transitional housing and support services for veterans in Wake County.

resources.name: Healing with CAARE
resources.description: Transitional housing and support services for veterans in Durham area.

resources.name: Maple Court (Volunteers of America)
resources.description: Transitional housing program operated by Volunteers of America for veterans in the Durham area.

resources.name: Triangle Residential Options for Substance Abusers (TROSA)
resources.description: Substance use disorder recovery and transitional housing services for veterans in the Triangle area.

resources.name: Servant Center
resources.description: Transitional housing and support services for veterans in the Greensboro/High Point area.

resources.name: Caring Services Vet Safety Net
resources.description: Veteran-specific safety net and support services in the Greensboro/High Point area.

resources.name: Arthur Cassell Transitional House
resources.description: Transitional housing facility for veterans in the Greensboro area.

resources.name: Veteran's Helping Veterans Heal
resources.description: Peer-based support and transitional housing services for veterans in Winston-Salem area.

resources.name: Good Shepard Ministries
resources.description: Faith-based transitional housing and support services for veterans in Wilmington area.

resources.name: Legal Aid of North Carolina - Veterans Law Project
resources.description: Specialized legal aid services for military veterans. Helps with disability compensation, discharge upgrades, VA overpayments, pension benefits, and government benefits representation.

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: Crisis support hotline for veterans in mental health crisis or experiencing suicidal thoughts. Available 24/7. Can also text 838255.

resources.name: NC Works - Veterans Employment Services
resources.description: Part of the Division of Workforce Services providing specialized employment assistance for veterans, transitioning service members, and eligible spouses. Includes resume building, job search, and job placement services.

resources.name: VA Housing Assistance Program
resources.description: Federal program providing home purchase, refinancing, and homeownership-related services for eligible veterans.

resources.name: North Carolina Housing Finance Agency
resources.description: State agency offering housing assistance programs for veterans including down payment assistance, mortgage credit certificates, and affordable rental housing.
